An August 2008 ''USA Today'' article reported "The last time Obama saw Ayers was about a year ago when he crossed paths with him while biking in the neighborhood," says Ben LaBolt, a campaign spokesman. "The suggestion that Ayers was a political adviser to Obama or someone who shaped his political views is patently false."{{cite news|last=Keen|first=Judy|date=2008-08-26|title=Obama dogged by links to 1960s radical|newspaper=USA Today|page=A7|url=http://usatoday30.usatoday.com/news/politics/election2008/2008-08-25-ayers_N.htm|accessdate=2012-11-01}}
{{cite news |first=Ron |last=Claiborne |title=McCain campaign goes on offense |url= http://abcnews.go.com/Politics/Conventions/story?id=5667094&singlePage=true |work=ABC News |date=2008-08-27 |accessdate=2008-10-12}} An October 2008 ''New York Times'' article reported that Obama did not have a significant relationship with Ayers. In a November 2008 ''Washington Post'' interview, Ayers said that he knew Obama only slightly: "I think my relationship with Obama was probably like that of thousands of others in Chicago and, like millions and millions of others, I wished I knew him better."{{cite news|last=Slevin|first=Peter|date=2008-11-05|title=Ayers decries GOP tactics, says he is not close to Obama|newspaper=The Washington Post|page=A32|url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/wp-dyn/content/article/2008/11/04/AR2008110404171.html|accessdate=2012-11-01}}
{{cite news |first=David |last=Remnick |title=Mr. Ayers’s neighborhood |url=http://www.newyorker.com/online/blogs/tny/2008/11/mr-ayerss-neighborhood.html?yrail |work=The New Yorker Blog |date=2008-11-04 |accessdate=2008-11-05| archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20081224081950/http://www.newyorker.com/online/blogs/tny/2008/11/mr-ayerss-neighborhood.html?yrail| archivedate= 24 December 2008 | deadurl= no}} ==Presidential campaign issue== Obama's contacts with Ayers had been public knowledge in Chicago for years.{{cite news |url=http://www.boston.com/news/nation/articles/2008/04/18/how_obama_and_the_radical_became_news/ |first=Joanna |last=Weiss |work=[[The Boston Globe]] |date=2008-04-18 |title=How Obama and the radical became news}} British writer [[Peter Hitchens]] wrote about Ayers in the ''[[Daily Mail]]'' in early February 2008.{{cite news |url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-511901/The-Black-Kennedy-But-does-know-real-Barack-Obama.html |work=Daily Mail |title=The Black Kennedy: But does anyone know the real Barack Obama? |first=Peter |last=Hitchens |date=2008-02-02 |location=London}}{{cite news |first=Michael |last=Dobbs |authorlink=Michael Dobbs (US author) |title=Obama's 'Weatherman' Connection |url=http://blog.washingtonpost.com/fact-checker/2008/02/obamas_weatherman_connection.html |work=The Fact Checker |publisher=The Washington Post |date=2008-02-19 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110523101434/http://blog.washingtonpost.com/fact-checker/2008/02/obamas_weatherman_connection.html |archivedate=2011-05-23 |df= }} The connection was then picked up by blogs and newspapers in the United States, including in the [[Huffington Post]].{{cite news |url=http://www.huffingtonpost.com/larry-c-johnson/no-he-cant-because-yes_b_87036.html |title=No, He Can't Because Yes, They Will |accessdate=2008-08-10 |first=Larry C. |last=Johnson |work=[[The Huffington Post]] |date=2008-02-16| archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20080820025635/http://www.huffingtonpost.com/larry-c-johnson/no-he-cant-because-yes_b_87036.html| archivedate= 20 August 2008 | deadurl= no}} ===Primary debates=== ''[[Washington Post]]'' media writer [[Howard Kurtz]] has written that the connection between the two Chicagoans was "all but ignored by the news media, other than Fox" until it was raised in a [[primary election|primary]] debate.{{cite news |first=Howard |last=Kurtz |authorlink=Howard Kurtz |title=The Military-Media Complex |url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/wp-dyn/content/article/2008/04/21/AR2008042100776.html |work=The Washington Post |date=2008-04-21 |accessdate=2008-10-13}} At that [[Democratic Party (United States) presidential debates, 2008|Democratic Party primary debate]] in [[Philadelphia]] on April 16, 2008, moderator George Stephanopoulos questioned Obama about his association with Ayers (after conservative commentator Sean Hannity suggested the question the day before).{{cite news |first=Faiz |last=Shakir |title=AUDIO: Hannity Feeds Stephanopoulos Debate Question On Weather Underground |url=http://thinkprogress.org/2008/04/17/steph-hannity-audio/ |work=Think Progress |publisher=[[Center for American Progress]] |date=2008-04-17 |accessdate=2008-10-13| archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20080915050627/http://thinkprogress.org/2008/04/17/steph-hannity-audio/| archivedate= 15 September 2008 | deadurl= no}} Stephanopoulos asked the candidate: "Can you explain that relationship for the voters, and explain to Democrats why it won't be a problem?"{{cite news |first=Ari |last=Berman |title=Obama Under the Weather |url=http://www.thenation.com/doc/20080519/berman |archive-url=https://archive.is/20130105023802/http://www.thenation.com/doc/20080519/berman |dead-url=yes |archive-date=2013-01-05 |work=[[The Nation]] |date=2008-05-01 |accessdate=2008-10-13}} Obama responded: {{quote|This is a guy who lives in my neighborhood, who's a professor of English in Chicago who I know and who I have not received some official endorsement from. He's not somebody who I exchange ideas from on a regular basis. And the notion that somehow as a consequence of me knowing somebody who engaged in detestable acts 40 years ago, when I was eight years old, somehow reflects on me and my values doesn't make much sense, George.{{cite news |url=http://abcnews.go.com/Politics/DemocraticDebate/Story?id=4670271&page=2 |title=Transcript: Obama and Clinton Debate |accessdate=2008-10-12 |work=ABC News |date=2008-04-16| archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20081013030240/http://abcnews.go.com/Politics/DemocraticDebate/Story?id=4670271&page=2| archivedate= 13 October 2008 | deadurl= no}}}} Obama's response led to an exchange with Clinton, in which Clinton said, "Senator Obama served on a board with Mr. Ayers for a period of time, the Woods Fund, which was a paid directorship position." Obama then referred to President [[Bill Clinton]]'s pardoning of [[Linda Sue Evans]] and [[Susan Rosenberg]],{{cite news |title=An Almost Oppo Free Zone |url=http://hotlineblog.nationaljournal.com/archives/2008/04/an_almost_oppo.html |work=[[The Hotline]] |date=2008-04-16 |accessdate=2008-10-13| archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20080915065943/http://hotlineblog.nationaljournal.com/archives/2008/04/an_almost_oppo.html| archivedate= 15 September 2008 | deadurl= no}} two former Weather Underground members convicted for their actions after joining the splinter group [[May 19 Communist Organization]]. The following Sunday, Stephanopoulos asked Republican presidential candidate John McCain about Obama's [[patriotism]], and McCain responded: "I'm sure he's very patriotic," then added, "But his relationship with Mr. Ayers is open to question." On May 17, as the controversy continued, the Obama campaign issued their own "Fact Check" regarding Clinton's statements on the alleged relationship between Ayers and Obama.[http://factcheck.barackobama.com/factcheck/2008/04/17/fact_check_on_clinton_attacks.php Fact Check on Obama and Ayers] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20080501051607/http://factcheck.barackobama.com/factcheck/2008/04/17/fact_check_on_clinton_attacks.php |date=2008-05-01 }} ''Barack Obama campaign website,'' April 17, 2008 ===General election campaign=== ====McCain and campaign statements==== In April 2008, John McCain began to question Obama's interactions with Ayers,{{cite news |first=Michael |last=Cooper |title=Republicans Focus on Obama as Fall Opponent |url=https://query.nytimes.com/gst/fullpage.html?res=9E03E2D6173AF93BA35756C0A96E9C8B63 |work=The New York Times |date=2008-05-08 |accessdate=2008-10-13}} and it became an issue later in the general election campaign. In August 2008, the Republican Party created the website, ''barackbook.com'',[http://www.barackbook.com barackbook.com] as a spoof of [[Facebook]], on which Ayers is listed as one of Obama's "friends." This website contains a mocked-up [[user profile]] for Ayers, which describes the matter and Obama's alleged connections with him.{{cite news |url=http://www.sfgate.com/cgi-bin/article.cgi?f=/c/a/2008/08/07/MN251268V8.DTL |work=[[San Francisco Chronicle]] |title=Campaign nastiness starts early |first=Carla |last=Marinucci |authorlink=Carla Marinucci |date=2008-08-08 |accessdate=2008-10-18}} That month, the [[American Issues Project]] began running an ad that emphasized the relationship between the two, which contained the following text: "Barack Obama is friends with Ayers, defending him as, quote, 'Respectable' and 'Mainstream.' Obama's political career was launched in Ayers's home. And the two served together on a left-wing board. Why would Barack Obama be friends with someone who bombed the Capitol and is proud of it? Do you know enough to elect Barack Obama?"{{cite news |first=Jim |last=Kuhnhenn |agency=[[Associated Press]] |title=Obama seeks to silence ad tying him to 60s radical |url=https://www.denverpost.com/2008/08/25/obama-seeks-to-silence-ad-tying-him-to-60s-radical/ |publisher=Denver Post |date=2008-08-25 |accessdate=2018-04-29}} In October 2008, after the McCain campaign announced that it would step up attacks on the Democratic presidential candidate,{{cite news |publisher=CNN |title=Obama campaign rejects Palin 'terrorist' gibe |url=http://www.cnn.com/2008/POLITICS/10/05/palin.obama.terrorist.claim/index.html |date=2008-10-05 |accessdate=2008-10-13| archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20081013005328/http://www.cnn.com/2008/POLITICS/10/05/palin.obama.terrorist.claim/index.html| archivedate= 13 October 2008 | deadurl= no}} Sarah Palin delivered speeches saying that Obama was "palling around with terrorists." For support, Palin cited a ''New York Times'' article that had actually concluded that Obama and Ayers were not close. The article stated that other "publications, including ''[[The Washington Post]],'' ''[[Time magazine|Time]]'' magazine, ''[[The Chicago Sun-Times]],'' ''[[The New Yorker]]'' and ''[[The New Republic]],'' have said that their reporting doesn't support the idea that Obama and Ayers had a close relationship." CNN has independently deemed Palin's allegations false, saying: "There is no indication that Ayers and Obama are now 'palling around,' or that they have had an ongoing relationship in the past three years. Also, there is nothing to suggest that Ayers is now involved in terrorist activity or that other Obama associates are." The [[Republican National Committee]]{{cite news |first=Chris |last=Cillizza |title=RNC Uses Ayers in New Ads |url=http://voices.washingtonpost.com/thefix/2008/10/rnc_uses_ayers_in_new_ads.html |work=[[The Fix (blog)|The Fix]] |publisher=The Washington Post |date=2008-10-08 |accessdate=2008-10-13}} and the McCain campaign each launched additional attack ads, calling Obama "too dangerous for America."{{cite video |date=2008-10-08 |title=Web Ad: Ayers |url=http://www.johnmccain.com/Informing/Multimedia/Player.aspx?GUID=9A48C156-AD6A-40BD-9381-98DDF66EC77A |publisher=[[John McCain presidential campaign, 2008]] |accessdate=2008-10-13| archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20081013033147/http://www.johnmccain.com/Informing/Multimedia/Player.aspx?guid=9a48c156-ad6a-40bd-9381-98ddf66ec77a| archivedate= 13 October 2008 | deadurl= no}} On October 16, the McCain campaign launched a massive [[robocall]] campaign which played an automated message linking Ayers to Obama.{{cite news |author=Associated Press |url=http://www.latimes.com/news/nationworld/nation/la-na-ayers17-2008oct17,0,4666998.story |title=McCain campaign's robocalls seek to link Obama, Ayers |work=Los Angeles Times |date=2008-10-17 |accessdate=2008-10-17 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20081020080530/http://www.latimes.com/news/nationworld/nation/la-na-ayers17-2008oct17%2C0%2C4666998.story |archivedate=20 October 2008 |deadurl=no |df= }} ====Obama campaign response==== The Obama campaign added a section about Ayers to its "Fight the Smears" website, where it argued that the attack by "a desperate McCain campaign" and other groups was a "smear",{{cite web| last = Obama '08| authorlink = Barack Obama presidential campaign, 2008| title = The Truth about Barack Obama and William Ayers| url = http://fightthesmears.com/articles/22/AyersSmear| accessdate = 2008-10-08| archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20081008223315/http://fightthesmears.com/articles/22/AyersSmear| archivedate = 8 October 2008| deadurl = yes| df = }} citing newspaper commentaries calling it "phony",{{Citation |title=Clearing up another empty shot at Obama |newspaper=[[Chicago Sun-Times]] |date=March 3, 2008 |url=http://www.suntimes.com/news/commentary/822560,CST-EDT-edit03a.article |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20081210101659/http://www.suntimes.com/news/commentary/822560%2CCST-EDT-edit03a.article |archivedate=December 10, 2008 |df= }} "tenuous".{{Citation| last = Dobbs| first = Michael| title = Obama's 'Weatherman' Connection| newspaper = The Washington Post| date = February 19, 2008| url = http://blog.washingtonpost.com/fact-checker/2008/02/obamas_weatherman_connection.html#more| deadurl = yes| archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20110523101434/http://blog.washingtonpost.com/fact-checker/2008/02/obamas_weatherman_connection.html#more| archivedate = May 23, 2011| df = }} and "exaggerated at best if not outright false".{{cite web| last = Daniel| first = Douglass K.| title = Analysis: Palin's words carry racial tinge| publisher = [[Cleveland.com]]| date = October 5, 2008| url =http://www.cleveland.com/nation/index.ssf/2008/10/analysis_palins_words_carry_a.html| accessdate = 2018-04-29}} In August 2008, the Obama campaign's attorney Robert Bauer wrote TV stations running the American Issues Project ad, saying, "Your station is committed to operating in the public interest, an objective that cannot be satisfied by accepting for compensation material of such malicious falsity," and wrote Deputy Assistant U.S. Attorney General [[John C. Keeney]], describing the ad as a "willful attempt to evade the strictures of federal election law." The Obama campaign ran a TV ad of its own in selected markets that said in part, "With all our problems, why is John McCain talking about the 60s, trying to link Barack Obama to radical Bill Ayers? McCain knows Obama denounced Ayers' crimes, committed when Obama was just eight years old."{{cite news|first=Jim|last=Kuhnhenn|author2=Associated Press|title=Obama, conservative group battle through DOJ|url=http://www.wtop.com/?nid=213&sid=1466240|publisher=[[WTOP-FM]] |date=2008-08-26 |accessdate=2008-10-13}} That month, Obama began responding to Palin's speeches on October 5, 2008, at an event in [[Asheville, North Carolina]]: "Senator McCain and his operatives are gambling that they can distract you with smears rather than talk to you about substance. They'd rather try to tear our campaign down than lift this country up. That's what you do when you're out of touch, out of ideas, and running out of time."{{cite news|title=Obama accuses McCain of looking for distractions|url=http://edition.cnn.com/2008/POLITICS/10/05/campaign.wrap/|work=CNN|accessdate=2008-10-13| archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20081008013915/http://edition.cnn.com/2008/POLITICS/10/05/campaign.wrap/| archivedate= 8 October 2008 | deadurl= no}} ====''Dreams from My Father''==== In 2008 and 2009 some conservative commentators advanced claims that Obama's [[autobiography]], ''[[Dreams from My Father]]'' was written or [[ghost-writer|ghost-written]] by Ayers. In a series of articles in [[American Thinker]] and [[WorldNetDaily]], author [[Jack Cashill]] claimed that his own analysis of the book showed Ayers' writing style. In late October, [[United States Congress|US Congressman]] [[Chris Cannon]] and his brother-in-law attempted to hire an [[Oxford University]] professor, [[Peter Millican]], to prove Ayers' authorship using computer analysis. Millican refused after they would not assure him in advance that his results would be published regardless of the outcome.{{cite news|publisher=The Sunday Times|url=http://www.timesonline.co.uk/tol/news/world/us_and_americas/us_elections/article5063279.ece?print=yes&randnum=1225630963546|author=Sarah Baxter|date=2008-10-02|title=Republicans try to use Oxford don to smear Barack Obama}}{{cite news|publisher=[[The Sunday Times]] |url=http://www.timesonline.co.uk/tol/news/world/us_and_americas/us_elections/article5062890.ece|title=How they tried to tarnish Barack Obama|author=Peter Millican|date=2008-10-02|location=London}}Thomas Burr, [http://www.sltrib.com/ci_10882415 "Congressman Cannon questions Obama authorship"], ''[[Salt Lake Tribune]],'' 11/03/2008 (courtesy link to article lede: http://qa.politicswest.com/node/32523/print)[http://www.upi.com/Top_News/2008/11/02/Obama_book_under_scrutiny/UPI-10351225654981/ Obama book under scrutiny"], [[United Press International]], November 2, 2008. Millican later criticized the claim, saying variously that he had "found no evidence for Cashill's ghostwriting hypothesis," that it was "unlikely"{{cite web |url=http://www.philocomp.net/humanities/dreams |title=Barack Obama's Dreams from My Father |author=Peter Millican |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20090628095905/http://www.philocomp.net/humanities/dreams |archivedate=2009-06-28 |df= }} and that he felt "totally confident that it is false." In his 2009 unauthorized biography ''[[Barack and Michelle]],'' author [[Christopher Andersen]] repeated Cashill's claim.{{cite news|publisher=''Johannesburg Times''|url=http://www.timeslive.co.za/sundaytimes/article136814.ece|title=Dreams from Obama's ghostwriter: Critics say he did not write his 1995 memoir alone|date=2009-10-03|author=Tymon Smith}} When asked about the claims in 2009 Ayers said, as an apparent joke, that he wrote the book at [[Michelle Obama]]'s request, setting off renewed coverage of the claims on conservative [[blog]]s.{{cite news|publisher=CBS News|url=http://www.cbsnews.com/blogs/2009/10/07/politics/politicalhotsheet/entry5370165.shtml|date=2009-10-07|title=Bill Ayers Book Comment Sets Blogs Abuzz|author=Brian Montopoli}} ===Ayers response=== Ayers himself kept a low profile during the controversy. After the election, he wrote an [[op-ed]] piece in which he explained:
With the mainstream news media and the blogosphere caught in the pre-election excitement, I saw no viable path to a rational discussion. Rather than step clumsily into the sound-bite culture, I turned away whenever the microphones were thrust into my face. I sat it out.{{Citation | last = Ayers | first = William | author-link = Bill Ayers | title = The Real Bill Ayers | newspaper = The New York Times | pages = A21 | date = December 6, 2008 | url = https://www.nytimes.com/2008/12/06/opinion/06ayers.html?_r=2 }}
His post-election piece argued that the attacks on Obama had been a "profoundly dishonest drama," including a false depiction of Ayers as a terrorist ("I never killed or injured anyone") and an exaggeration of his connection to Obama ("We didn't pal around, and I had nothing to do with his positions"). In a 2013 interview with the [[Daily Beast]], Ayers said the following:
David Axelrod said we were friendly, that was true; we served on a couple of boards together, that was true; he held a fundraiser in our living room, that was true; Michelle [Obama] and Bernardine were at the law firm together, that was true. Hyde Park in Chicago is a tiny neighborhood, so when he said I was "a guy around the neighborhood," that was true. Today, I wish I knew him better and he was listening to me. Obama’s not a radical. I wish he were, but he’s not.{{cite news|url=http://www.thedailybeast.com/articles/2013/04/03/exclusive-bill-ayers-on-the-weathermen-obama-s-crap-job-more.html|title=Exclusive: Bill Ayers On the Weathermen, Obama’s Crap Job & More}}
==Reactions to the controversy== After the controversy arose, Ayers was defended by officials and others in Chicago. Mayor [[Richard M. Daley]] issued a statement in support of Bill Ayers the next day (April 17, 2008), as did the ''[[Chicago Tribune]]'' in an editorial.{{cite news|first=Mike|last=Dorning|author2=Rick Pearson|title=Daley: Don't tar Obama for Ayers|url=http://blogs.trb.com/news/politics/blog/2008/04/daley_dont_tar_obama_for_ayers.html|work=[[The Chicago Tribune]]|date=2008-04-17|accessdate=2008-10-17|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20080821150215/http://blogs.trb.com/news/politics/blog/2008/04/daley_dont_tar_obama_for_ayers.html|archivedate=August 21, 2008|deadurl=yes|df=}}{{cite news|author=Tribune editorial|title=Guilt by association|work=The Chicago Tribune|url=http://www.chicagotribune.com/news/chi-0418edit3apr18,0,7443216.story|date=April 18, 2008|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20080722221247/http://www.chicagotribune.com/news/chi-0418edit3apr18%2C0%2C7443216.story|archivedate=July 22, 2008|accessdate=2009-04-30|deadurl=yes|df=}} On April 18, [[John F. Harris]] and [[Jim VandeHei]] of [[Politico]] wrote that questions "about Obama’s association with 1960s radical William Ayers ... were entirely in-bounds. If anything, they were overdue for a front-runner and likely nominee." [http://dyn.politico.com/printstory.cfm?uuid=63C6F505-3048-5C12-0030F1E8CB81ACD8 Obama's secret weapon: The media] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20130310153928/http://dyn.politico.com/printstory.cfm?uuid=63C6F505-3048-5C12-0030F1E8CB81ACD8 |date=2013-03-10 }} by John F. Harris and Jim VandeHei, ''Politico'', April 18, 2008 Ayers remained on the Board of Directors of the Woods Fund of Chicago.{{cite web |title=Board of Directors and Officers|url=http://www.woodsfund.org/about/staff|work=Woods Fund website |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20080104064910/http://www.woodsfund.org/about/staff|archivedate=January 4, 2008 }} Woods Fund Chair Washington said it was "ridiculous to suggest there's anything inappropriate" about the two men serving on the foundation board. In late May 2008, [[Michael Kinsley]], a longtime critic of Ayers,{{cite web|url=http://www.politico.com/blogs/bensmith/0508/Kinsley_on_Ayers.html|title= Kinsley on Ayers|accessdate=2008-06-01|last=Smith|first=Ben|date=2008-05-30|work=Ben Smith's Blog|publisher=[[Politico (newspaper)|Politico]] }} argued in ''[[Time (magazine)|Time]]'' that Obama's relationship with Ayers should not be a campaign issue:{{Quote|If Obama's relationship with Ayers, however tangential, exposes Obama as a radical himself, or at least as a man with terrible judgment, he shares that radicalism or terrible judgment with a comically respectable list of Chicagoans and others—including Republicans and conservatives—who have embraced Ayers and Dohrn as good company, good citizens, even experts on children's issues ... Ayers and Dohrn are despicable, and yet making an issue of Obama's relationship with them is absurd.{{cite news|first=Michael|last=Kinsley|authorlink=Michael Kinsley|title=Rejecting Obama's Radical Friends|url=http://www.time.com/time/magazine/article/0,9171,1810338,00.html |work=[[Time (magazine)|Time]]|date=2008-05-29|accessdate=2008-06-01 }}}} The Obama-Ayers connection was mentioned in [[Jerome Corsi]]'s ''[[The Obama Nation]],'' a book published in August and intended to help defeat Obama;[https://www.nytimes.com/2008/08/13/us/politics/13book.html?bl&ex=1218772800&en=bf042c4d96f94d9e&ei=5087%0A&_r=0 Book Attacking Obama Hopes to Repeat ’04 Anti-Kerry Feat], New York Times, August 12, 2008 and in conservative author David Freddoso's ''[[The Case Against Barack Obama]],'' where he wrote that the situation raised questions about Obama's judgment and influences.{{cite book|first=David|last=Freddoso |authorlink=David Freddoso|title=[[The Case Against Barack Obama]]|publisher=[[Regnery Publishing]]|location=[[Washington, D.C.]]|year=2008|pages=122–123|isbn=1-59698-566-6}} In May and August, ''Chicago Tribune'' columnist and editorial board member Steve Chapman suggested that while Obama was "justly criticized for his ties" to Ayers, the coverage of that connection should be matched by equal coverage of John McCain's associating with convicted [[Watergate]] burglar [[G. Gordon Liddy]].{{cite news|first=Steve|last=Chapman|title=Obama's radical friend|url=http://newsblogs.chicagotribune.com/steve_chapman/2008/08/obamas-radical.html|work=Chicago Tribune|date=2008-08-22|accessdate=2008-10-18| archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20081026061558/http://newsblogs.chicagotribune.com/steve_chapman/2008/08/obamas-radical.html| archivedate= 26 October 2008 | deadurl= no}}{{cite news|first=Steve|last=Chapman|title=With friends like these...|url=http://www.chicagotribune.com/news/opinion/oped/chi-oped0504chapmanmay04,0,3136852.column|work=Chicago Tribune|date=2008-05-04|accessdate=2008-10-18|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20081025120014/http://www.chicagotribune.com/news/opinion/oped/chi-oped0504chapmanmay04%2C0%2C3136852.column|archivedate=25 October 2008|deadurl=yes|df=}} On September 23, 2008, [[Stanley Kurtz]], a conservative commentator and Senior Fellow at the [[Ethics and Public Policy Center]], wrote an op-ed in ''[[The Wall Street Journal]]'' after reviewing the archives of the Chicago Annenberg Exchange (CAC) at the Daley Library of the University of Illinois at Chicago.{{cite news |first=Stanley |last=Kurtz |authorlink=Stanley Kurtz |title=Obama and Ayers pushed radicalism on schools (op-ed) |url=https://www.wsj.com/articles/SB122212856075765367 |newspaper=The Wall Street Journal |page=A29 |date=2008-09-23 |accessdate=2008-10-08| archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20081011171732/http://online.wsj.com/article/SB122212856075765367.html| archivedate= 2008-10-11}} In Kurtz's opinion, "Mr. Obama and Mr. Ayers worked as a team to advance the CAC agenda" and "As CAC chairman, Mr. Obama was lending moral and financial support to Mr. Ayers and his radical circle." [[Sol Stern]], a longtime critic of Ayers' ideas about school reform, wrote in [[City Journal (New York)|''City Journal'']] that "the press—and debate moderators—shouldn’t let Bill Ayers and Barack Obama off the hook," and that "Calling Bill Ayers a school reformer is a bit like calling Joseph Stalin an agricultural reformer.".[http://www.city-journal.org/2008/eon1006ss.html "The Bomber as School Reformer"], City Journal, 6 October 2008 William C. Ibershof, the lead federal prosecutor of the Weather Underground case, wrote to ''The New York Times'' on October 9, 2008:{{Quote|I am amazed and outraged that Senator Barack Obama is being linked to William Ayers’s terrorist activities 40 years ago when Mr. Obama was, as he has noted, just a child. Although I dearly wanted to obtain convictions against all the Weathermen, including Bill Ayers, I am very pleased to learn that he has become a responsible citizen.{{cite news |first=William C. |last=Ibershof |title= Prosecuting Weathermen (Letter to the Editor) |url=https://www.nytimes.com/2008/10/10/opinion/l10ayers.html |work=The New York Times |date=2008-10-09 |accessdate=2008-10-18| archiveurl= https://archive.is/20110512134756/http://www.nytimes.com/2008/10/10/opinion/l10ayers.html| archivedate=May 12, 2011| deadurl= no}}}} == References == {{reflist|2}} ==External links== *[https://web.archive.org/web/20080501051607/http://factcheck.barackobama.com/factcheck/2008/04/17/fact_check_on_clinton_attacks.php Fack Check on Obama and Ayers], [[Organizing for America]], April 17, 2008 *[https://web.archive.org/web/20090221234200/http://www.factcheck.org/elections-2008/he_lied_about_bill_ayers.html "He Lied" About Bill Ayers?], ''[[FactCheck.org]]'', October 10, 2008 *[http://www.snopes.com/politics/obama/ayers.asp Putting on Ayers], [[Snopes]], December 6, 2008 {{Barack Obama}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Ayers, Bill}} [[Category:Barack Obama presidential campaign, 2008]] [[Category:United States election controversies]] [[Category:21st-century controversies in the United States]] [[Category:Weather Underground]] [[Category:2008 in American politics]] [[Category:2008 controversies]] [[Category:Barack Obama controversies]]

Voice | setting = [[Switzerland]], [[England]] and [[Italy]] 1816-1822 | premiere = {{Start date|1984|10|01|df=yes}} | place = [[Haymarket Theatre (Leicester)|Haymarket Theatre Leicester]] | orig_lang = English | series = | subject = | genre = | web = }} '''''Bloody Poetry''''' is a 1984 play by [[Howard Brenton]] centring on the lives of [[Percy Shelley]] and his circle. The play had its roots in Brenton's involvement with the small touring company [[Foco Novo]] and was the third, and final, show he wrote for them. The initial idea was that Brenton should write a piece based on the life of Shelley, though Brenton was more interested in looking, not at the individual, but at the quartet of Percy, [[Mary Shelley]], [[Lord Byron]] and Byron's mistress [[Claire Clairmont]], tying it in with [[Utopian]] themes appropriate to the revolutionary spirit of the protagonists. In his introduction to the play Brenton disclaims any interest in moralising over the actions of his characters, as he had in a [[programme (booklet)|programme]] to his earlier play ''[[Weapons of Happiness]]''.''Plays: 2'' by Howard Brenton, [[Methuen Publishing|Methuen]], p. xiv 1996 reprint {{ISBN|978-0-413-61490-2}}[http://www.nationaltheatre.org.uk/1647/productions/weapons-of-happiness.html "National Theatre"] Retrieved on 11 October 2009 The play takes as its epigraph a comment of [[Richard Holmes (biographer)|Richard Holmes]]'s, “Shelley's life seems more a haunting than a history.” ==Stage history== ''Bloody Poetry'' was first performed at the Haymarket Theatre Leicester on 1 October 1984 in a production that later played at the [[Hampstead Theatre]]. The director was [[Roland Rees]] and the cast was: [[Percy Bysshe Shelley]] – [[Valentine Pelka]]
[[Mary Shelley]] – [[Fiona Shaw]]
[[Claire Clairmont]] – [[Jane Gurnett]]
[[George Byron]] – [[James Aubrey (actor)|James Aubrey]]
[[John William Polidori|Dr William Polidori]] – [[William Gaminara]]
[[Percy Bysshe Shelley#Marriage|Harriet Westbrook]] – [[Sue Burton]] The play played at the [[Manhattan Theatre Club]] in 1987 in a production directed by [[Lynne Meadow]][http://theater2.nytimes.com/mem/theater/treview.html?res=9B0DE6DD1731F934A35752C0A961948260 Review] Retrieved on 11 October 2009 and was revived in 1988 at the [[Royal Court Theatre]] and in 2007 at the [[Chapter Arts Centre]], [[Cardiff]].[http://www.britishtheatreguide.info/reviews/bloodypoetryMovBeing-rev.htm Review] Retrieved on 11 October 2009 The play was staged by emerging company Invulnerable Nothings at [[The Brooklyn Art Library]] in 2016. ==Notes== {{reflist}} ==External links== * {{iobdb show|Bloody%20Poetry}} {{Howard Brenton}} [[Category:1984 plays]] [[Category:British plays]] [[Category:Plays based on actual events]] [[Category:Plays based on real people]] [[Category:Plays set in England]] [[Category:Plays set in the 19th century]] [[Category:Cultural depictions of Lord Byron]] [[Category:Cultural depictions of Mary Shelley]] [[Category:Cultural depictions of Percy Bysshe Shelley]] {{1980s-play-stub}}

{{Infobox theatre festival | name = Breakin' Convention | image = JonziD.jpg | caption = Jonzi D at Breakin' Convention 2006. | location = [[Sadler's Wells Theatre]],
[[London]], [[United Kingdom|UK]] | founded = 2004 | founders = | dates = every year in May | play_type = [[hip-hop theater|hip-hop theatre]] | website = http://www.breakinconvention.com }} '''Breakin’ Convention''' is an international [[hip-hop theater|hip-hop theatre]] festival based in [[London]], [[England]] that was founded in 2004 and is produced annually by [[Sadler's Wells Theatre]]. It has been under the artistic direction of playwright and dancer [[Jonzi D]] since its inception. Since May 2008 Breakin’ Convention has expanded its activity beyond the three-day festival to include tours across the [[United Kingdom|UK]], developing new theatre work with local hip-hop artists, and to produce year-round professional development courses for UK-based hip-hop choreographers, artists, and dance/theatre companies. ==Festival origin== Early in 2003 Jonzi D and recently appointed chief executive of Sadler's Wells, [[Alistair Spalding]], proposed the idea of a hip hop festival that took over the entire venue celebrating [[hip hop culture]] with an emphasis on dance. Appointing Jonzi D as an associate at the theatre and founding Still Brock Productions (later: Jonzi D Productions) to focus on education and professional development of [[hip hop dance]] in the UK, the festival brought over early pioneers of the culture including The Electric Boogaloos, Tommy The Clown and Vagabond Crew, and introducing future award-winning companies such as ZooNation and Boy Blue Entertainment. Breakin' Convention is supported by [[Arts Council England]]. ==See also== {{Commons category|Breakin' Convention}} *[[List of hip hop music festivals]] *[[Hip hop culture]] *[[Battle of the Year]] *[[The Notorious IBE]] ==External links== *[http://www.breakinconvention.com Breakin' Convention] official website *[http://www.sadlerswells.com Sadler's Wells] official website *[http://www.jonzi-d.co.uk Jonzi D] official website *[http://toomuchflavour.co.uk/breakinconvention.html Breakin' Convention 2009] 2MF magazine feature {{Hip hop festival}} [[Category:Theatre festivals in the United Kingdom]] [[Category:Recurring events established in 2004]] [[Category:Festivals in London]] [[Category:Dance festivals in the United Kingdom]] [[Category:Hip hop music festivals]] [[Category:Music festivals established in 2004]] [[Category:Hip hop theatre festivals]] {{hip-hop-stub}} {{Theat-festival-stub}}

{{Infobox Website | name = BuyTigers.com | logo = | url = {{url|http://buytigers.com/}} | type = Satirical website | commercial = No | registration = None needed | owner = Aldo Tripiciano | author = Aldo Tripiciano | launch date = {{Start date and years ago|mf=yes|2006|3|5}} | current status = Online }}
'''BuyTigers.com''' is a [[Satire|satirical]] website which claims to sell tigers online and ship them worldwide. After complaints by [[People for the Ethical Treatment of Animals]] (PETA), the author revealed the site to be a hoax.
== History == BuyTigers.com was designed by Aldo Tripiciano, an Italian webmaster and [[search engine optimization]] (SEO) professional. On March 5, 2006, the first version of the BuyTigers.com site was published by Tripiciano on a private web server. Promoted by Tripiciano, the site grew in popularity and attracted controversy from concerned animal rights activists. In September 2008, [[People for the Ethical Treatment of Animals|PETA]] petitioned the [[Indian Government]]<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.igovernment.in/site/PETA-asks-govt-to-probe-website-that-sells-tigers |archive-url=https://archive.is/20130218073350/http://www.igovernment.in/site/PETA-asks-govt-to-probe-website-that-sells-tigers |dead-url=yes |archive-date=2013-02-18 |title=PETA requests the government for investigation over BuyTigers |work=iGovernment.in |date=2008-09-11 |accessdate=2013-11-06 }}</ref><ref>{{cite web | url=http://ibnlive.in.com/news/tiger-shopping-site-invites-petas-ire/73357-5-1.html|title=Tiger shopping site invites PETA's ire|work=[[CNN-IBN]]|date=2008-09-11|accessdate=2013-11-06}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.indianexpress.com/news/website-offers-tigers--bred-in-india--for-sale/360685/0|title=Website offers tigers 'bred in India' for sale|last=Sinha|first=Neha|work=[[The Indian Express]]|date=2008-09-13|accessdate=2013-11-06}}</ref> and Italian [[Guardia di Finanza]]. Following the investigation, Tripiciano posted a public disclaimer that revealed the site as a hoax.<ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.buytigers.com/truth.php|title=The Truth about buytigers.com|last=Tripiciano|first=Aldo|work=buytigers.com|accessdate=2013-11-06}}</ref> After the [[2011 Ohio exotic animal release]], the site received further media attention.<ref>{{cite web | url=http://money.msn.com/saving-money-tips/post.aspx?post=ac4fb3ec-64f6-4601-ae7a-211babb6d3f4|title=Lions and tigers and bears -- at home?|last=Smith|first=Giselle|work=[[MSN Money]]|date=2011-10-20|accessdate=2013-11-06}}</ref>
== Site == [[File:Logo of the BuyTigers site.gif|thumb|BuyTigers.com logo]] BuyTigers.com consists of a single-page website with pictures of young tigers, presented as if real examples of animals offered for sale. The site claims that tigers, despite being strong and dangerous predators, are trained to be loving, loyal and "totally harmless" pets. The website also claims to have been shipping tigers worldwide since 1984. A "tiger package", offered for $13,400, includes a five-month-old female tiger, an ivory collar, tiger toys, and a training guide.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.mumbaimirror.com/mumbai/others/PETA-asks-State-to-probe-website-that-sells-tigers/articleshow/15851382.cms|title=PETA asks State to probe website that sells tigers|work=[[Mumbai Mirror]]|date=2008-09-12|accessdate=2013-11-06}}</ref>
The site was selected by the radio network [[Heart (radio network)|Heart]] as one of the best Internet hoaxes of all time.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.heart.co.uk/photos/best-internet-hoaxes-all-time/|title=Best Internet Hoaxes of All Time|work=[[Heart (radio network)|Heart]]|accessdate=2013-11-06}}</ref>

{{Use dmy dates|date=October 2016}} {{Use Australian English|date=October 2016}} {{Infobox recurring event |name = Caxton Street Festival. |logo = |image = |caption = Patrons enjoying the food wine and atmosphere of the caxton street seafood and wine festival |location = [[Brisbane]], [[Queensland]], [[Australia]] |years_active = 1994 to present |founded = 1994 |dates = Labour Day weekend |genre = community festival |patron = |website = {{URL|www.caxtonstreet.com.au}} }} The '''Caxton Street Seafood and Wine Festival''' is an annual event which was launched in 1994 by the Caxton Street Development Association to promote Caxton Street in historic [[Petrie Terrace]] as a significant entertainment precinct that celebrates and promotes Australian music, seafood and wine. It features live music, food and drink from Caxton Street restaurants and cafés, as well as Art Exhibitions and Historical Displays and a dedicated annual Festival Band Competition. By 2012, the Festival attracted more than 15000 patrons. Proceeds from the Street Tickets are donated to various Queensland charities significantly in 2012 to the [[Wesley Hospital (Brisbane)]]Kim Walters Choices Program.
Held traditionally on the Sunday of the Labour Day long weekend, until 2013, the Festival is a promotion of the Queensland Seafood and Wine industries as well as a major Queensland Music Festival. Since its inception in 1994, it has featuring artists such as Russell Crowe and [[30 Odd Foot of Grunts]], [[1927 (band)]], [[Boom Crash Opera]], [[The Angels (Australian band)]], [[Gang Gajang]], [[Little Birdy]], [[Grace Knight]], [[Kevin Borich]], Kram of [[Spiderbait]], [[Dukes of Windsor]], [[Calling All Cars (band)]], [[Don Walker (musician)]], [[Tyrone Noonan]] and [[Diana Anaid]] plus celebrities from Australian Idol, Big Brother and musical acts from all over Australia playing a variety of music styles.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.brisbanetimes.com.au/entertainment/your-brisbane/caxton-street-festival-20090417-a9xs.html |title=Caxton Street festival |accessdate=13 January 2010 |date=17 April 2009 |work=[[Brisbane Times]] |publisher=Fairfax Digital }}</ref> From 2014, it is held on the Queens Birthday long weekend in June.
The Caxton Street Seafood Festival is located on [[Caxton Street, Brisbane]] only a short 200 m away from [[Suncorp Stadium]] and a few minutes from the [[Brisbane central business district]].
From 2003 to 2014, Manny Kyriakidis of The Pushworth Group,<ref name="The Courier Mail">{{cite web |url= http://www.theaustralian.com.au/seafood-fest-goes-upmarket/story-e6freq7f-1225705318570 |title=Caxton Street seafood and wine festival goes upmarket |date=1 May 2009 |work=[[The Courier-Mail]] |location=Brisbane, Australia |publisher=[[Queensland Newspapers]] |accessdate=30 August 2012}}</ref> has produced the event's music programs and 2009-2014, Nichola Burton of Australian Festival Management<ref name="The Courier Mail 2">{{cite web |url=http://quest-news.whereilive.com.au/lifestyle/story/get-hooked-on-festival-fever/ |title=Get hooked on festival fever - Westside News - Lifestyle - Quest News |work=[[The Courier-Mail]] |location=Brisbane, Australia |publisher=[[Queensland Newspapers]] |date=28 Apr 2009 |accessdate=30 August 2012 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://archive.is/20121231003946/http://quest-news.whereilive.com.au/lifestyle/story/get-hooked-on-festival-fever/ |archivedate=31 December 2012 |df=dmy-all }}</ref> has managed the annual festival and Sam Kyriakidis of Pressing Issues has been the Publicist.<ref name="Brisbane Media Map">{{cite web |url=http://www.brisbanemediamap.com.au/public/sub_category/37/client/1101 |title=Caxton Street Seafood and Wine Festival |first=Nur Azerinna |last=Zulkifli |work=Brisbane Media Map |publisher=[[Queensland University of Technology]] |location=Brisbane, Australia |date=27 October 2011 |accessdate=30 August 2012 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110821202015/http://www.brisbanemediamap.com.au/public/sub_category/37/client/1101 |archivedate=21 August 2011 |df=dmy-all }}</ref> Due to illness, the Pushworth team took a break for 2015 and 2016.
In 2011, inspired by the [[2010–2011 Queensland floods]], Queensland Artist, Donna Hawkins, produced a vibrant artwork representation of [[Caxton Street, Brisbane]] specifically for the festival.<ref name="The Courier Mail 3">{{cite web |url=http://westside-news.whereilive.com.au/lifestyle/story/caxton-st-spirit/ |title=Caxton St spirit - Events - Lifestyle - Westside News |work=[[The Courier-Mail]] |location=Brisbane, Australia |publisher=[[Queensland Newspapers]] |date=15 March 2011 |accessdate=30 August 2012 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120809062625/http://westside-news.whereilive.com.au/lifestyle/story/caxton-st-spirit/ |archivedate=9 August 2012 |df=dmy-all }}</ref>
Brisbane’s iconic Caxton Street was left high and dry during Queensland’s devastating floods that have again affected many parts of this great State. Having raised substantial funds for the Premiers Disaster Relief Appeal in 2011, Caxton Street donated part proceeds from all tickets sold to the Queensland Floods Appeal 2013. While Queenslanders have endured the worst, this natural disaster provides people the opportunity to show their best, and the Caxton Street Seafood & Wine Festival hopes to support those in the face of yet another challenge.
The Caxton Street Seafood & Wine Festival continues its long standing relationship with the Wesley Hospital’s Prostate Cancer Care program each year as charity partner.
